flawed_nl_solution:
The season is broken up into 22/2=<<22/2=11>>11 episode based on cost
The first 11 episodes cost 11*1000=${<<11*1000=11000>>}11000
The next set of episodes cost 1000*1.2=${<<1000*1.2=1020>>}1020 more per episode
So they cost 1000+1020=${<<1000+1020=2020>>}2020 each
So in total they cost 2020*11=${<<2020*11=22220>>}22220
So in total the season cost 22220+11000=${<<22220+11000=33220>>}33220

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200.0, not 1020.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
